definition[0]: a complete change in ways of thinking, methods of working etc
example[0]: the biggest social revolution we have had in this country
example[2]: In the last ten years there has been a revolution in education.
definition[1]: a time when people change a ruler or political system by using force or violence
example[4]: The role of women has changed since the revolution.
example[5]: The country seems to be heading towards revolution.
example[6]: the planetsâ€™ revolution around the Sun
definition[3]: one complete circular spinning movement, made by something such as a wheel attached to a central point
example[7]: a speed of 100 revolutions per minute
definition[4]: an attempt by a large group of people at revolution
example[8]: a popular uprising (=involving ordinary people, not the army)
definition[5]: an occasion when a group of people, especially soldiers, suddenly take control of a country
example[10]: Computer technology has caused a revolution in working practices.
